page.title: 09Merthyr Dyfan Church
page.content: Merthyr Dyfan church. In a dingle near a brook which flows from colcot is a church dedicated to St Dyfan. there were two saints called dyfan.. The first came to christianise our forefathers. The second Dyfan lived about the C6th and was the son of a Welsh chieftain. A board attached to the porch of the church states that 8t was founded in 600 AD. It was restored during the middle of the last century. Dyfan was martyred and the place where he was Martyred took the name Merthyr Dyfan meaning the Martyr Dyfan. It is still a centre for christian worship, where regular services witness to the endurance of faith.
